intro: Cleidion xyphophylloides, commonly known as the Caribbean silk tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain small, oval seeds. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
